content.rendered:
I fell for this company as soon as I heard their pitch on Shark Tank. How could you not love a business that sells an empty box for $8?

One of the founders worked at The Onion, the other is an experienced Graphic Designer. Together they have created a company that sells prank gift boxes. You buy a box for a prank gift and then include your real gift inside. What a brilliant idea!

They were featured on Season 10, Episode 7 and received multiple offers but ultimately accepted a deal from Barbara. I can’t wait to see how their company does.

Visit Prank-O on Amazon

jetpack-related-posts.title: Scrub Daddy
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Who doesn’t love a sponge with a smiley face? Apparently everyone does! After getting a deal on Shark Tank with Lori Greiner ($200,000 for 20%), Scrub Daddy has gone on to sell more than $170,000,000! I love using the Scrub Daddy at home. It makes washing dishes easier and more…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Cup Board Pro
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: I have to admit, I got a little emotional during the pitch for Cup Board Pro. Here were three young people promoting a product made by their father. His dream was to pitch his creation on Shark Tank, but passed away just a few months before. Keith Young was a…
